likelihood_impact_change.explanation: Under the 'Net Zero 2050' scenario, with increased investment in renewable energy and stringent policies, the likelihood of extreme weather events impacting operations is expected to decrease moderately due to improved resilience and infrastructure. The impact of such events on Mac Hardware operations may slightly decrease as well, due to better risk management strategies and adaptive measures.

emerging_opportunities.description: The rising demand for energy-efficient and sustainable technology products could lead to new Mac Hardware offerings focused on eco-friendliness.
Investment in robust supply chain strategies to adapt to climate risks could strengthen relationships with suppliers and improve operational efficiency.

additional_challenges.description: Extreme weather events may still disrupt the supply chain for key components, despite improvements, impacting production timelines.
Increased regulatory scrutiny and compliance costs related to climate policies could pose challenges for manufacturing processes and operational flexibility.

mitigation_strategies.description: Expand the supplier base across different regions to minimize the impact of localized extreme weather events on production.
Transition manufacturing facilities to renewable energy sources to reduce dependency on fossil fuels and mitigate operational risks from energy shortages.
Develop and regularly update disaster recovery and business continuity plans tailored to potential climate impacts on operations.
